content: Yes, indeed, it is hoped that more people will have access to this technology in the future to enable them to benefit from the many potential applications of virtual reality in healthcare. While access to virtual reality technology and the necessary funding for treatment remains a challenge, there is growing evidence that it can improve access to care, reduce costs, and improve patient outcomes, leading to a higher-quality health care delivery. The growth and continued development of this technology will undoubtedly bring new opportunities and challenges, but ultimately, it's exciting to see the positive impact virtual reality can have in healthcare and people with disabilities.
